word_mean: 前庭：管道进口的空间或腔，亦称vestibulum〔NA〕

sentence.Network_en: I have to ask David to wait in the vestibule.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只好让戴维在前厅等着.

sentence.Network_en: There was a flurry of excitement in the vestibule.
sentence.Network_cn: 过道里传来一阵匆忙的脚步声.

sentence.Network_en: Stepping into the vestibule, he propositioned her immediately.
sentence.Network_cn: 一踏进前厅, 他便迫不及待地向她提出要求.

...一、口腔医院二、口腔医生，口腔借上、下牙弓分为前外侧部的口腔前庭(oral vestibule)和后内侧部的固有口腔(oral cavity proper)；当上、下颌牙咬合时，口腔前庭与固有口腔之间可借第三磨牙后方的间隙相通.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting the space in front of the main entrance of a Roman or Greek building): from French, or from Latin vestibulum 'entrance court'

entry.def: A vestibule is an enclosed area between the outside door of a building and the inside door.

means.word_mean: 1. a large entrance or reception room or area
2. any of various bodily cavities leading to another cavity (as of the ear or vagina)
